activities: Dover will use and otherwise process EU Employee Data in the United States for the following purposes: Personnel administration; Compensation related activities; Performance and training management, including compliance and personnel development training; Benefits administration; Salary and bonus information for reporting purposes; Providing IT support; Providing company centralized directory functionality for email and other communications purposes; and Reviewing and enforcing compliance with company policies and procedures. As necessary in connection with these purposes, limited members of the Human Resources department and the IT department and senior executive company managers in the United States may access and otherwise process EU Employee Data in connection with their job responsibilities. Dover takes appropriate steps to ensure that such personnel are bound to duties of confidentiality with respect to EU Employee Data. This certification is inclusive for Dover Corporation and its subsidiaries and affiliates in the United States that receive data from European affiliates, including: Microwave Products Group, OK International, Datamax-O’Neil, Markem-Imaje, Belvac Production Machinery, Hill PHOENIX, SWEP, Tipper Tie, Unified Brands, Cook Compression, Dover Artificial Lift, Quartzdyne, US Synthetic, Waukesha Bearings Corp., Colder Products Company, Hydro Systems, OPW Fuel Management Systems, OPW Fueling Components, OPW Fuel Containment Systems, OPW Fibrelite, Pump Solutions, DE-STA-CO Industries, Texas Hydraulics, Tulsa Winch, Warn Industries, Environmental Solutions Group, Heil Environmental, Marathon Equipment Co., Performance Motorsports, Sargent, PDQ Manufacturing, Vehicle Service Group, Maag Group, Anthony International, Inc., Finder, and MS Printing Solutions.
